attributes.action: Re-evaluate and change The Dangerous Dogs Act 1991. End breed discrimination
attributes.additional_details: Following the recent video that's surfaced of the police taking away a perfectly safe dog from its owner, causing it unnecessary stress and suffering, you should be dealing with dogs that are actually a danger, not descrimating because of its breed. You wouldn't descrimate against a person because of their colour or background. We as the UK are meant to be a nation of animal lovers yet this act is a load of rubbish, it's ineffective, old-fashioned and unethical.
attributes.background: The government needs to re-evaluate this old fashioned act. Dogs should not be euthanized or taken from owners due to their breed. Dogs should be evaluated as an individual, not defined a 'category' .

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Abolish the Dangerous Dogs Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562925

End breed specific legislation: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558354
